page.title: 13Clun Carnival and Show
page.content: Clun Carnival takes place every year on the first Saturday in August. The carnival procession starts at School Road. It consists of fancy dress classes. There are classes for individuals, groups and drays. The processional route is: Church Street Bridge Street, High Street, Ford Street, Newport Street, Castle Street and into The Square. Every year there is a carnival queen and she has an attendant and page boy. After they have crowned the queen the procession goes to the Castle Grounds. There they have stalls, a large exhibitors' tent and a brass band playing. During the afternoon there are competitions, sideshows, amusements and refreshments for everyone. Clun Show has three sections for the exhibitor. They are the Horticultural, Agricultural, and Homecraft sections.
